data.title: Outstanding food and service!
data.text: In Chicago for the weekend and this was our first breakfast, and it was delicious!  The crepes, egg bowls, and pancakes were great.  The waitress Priscilla was funny and very friendly.  I recommend this place for breakfast to all.

data.title: Great little place ....
data.text: Had to come to Chicago ... got off the plane and it was time for breakfast ... did a quick search and decided to come here.  It did not disappoint.  Multiple greetings coming in the door.  Everyone was so friendly.  Pricilla was our waitress and she was awesome.   Hermie got 2 eggs 2 bacon and 2 pancakes.  I got the California Eggs Benedict.  The food was good.  What made it great was the quickness of the service coupled with how friendly everyone is.  You won't know to come here unless you look for it as it is a bit off the track.  I hope this helps - Ray and Hermie

data.title: Excellent choice for breakfast
data.text: In some ways, this place is a bit off of the beaten track, as it is just outside the Des Plaines business district.  But almost every time, I've gone past here, they seem very crowded.  Today, it was an exception.  With plenty of place to park, this is a small local breakfast and lunch restaurant.  Everyone, including our server, was very friendly.  The service was quick and the food tasted great.  We had eggs with hash browns and corned beef hash and it was a large portion.  We also tried the apple stuffed French Toast and it would be worth going back for.  I don't think this place will let you down, unless you can't get in.

data.title: Very good but not great
data.text:
I was greeted promptly, sat immediately, and offered coffee as soon as I sat down. They have French vanilla and hazelnut creamer to go along with the half-and-half on the table. 

I had the standard egg breakfast over medium, with bacon, hash browns, and pancakes. The breakfast was served with in 5 minutes. The plate was plentiful with 3 eggs instead of 2, 4 crispy pieces of bacon and hash browns that looked quite crispy. The pancakes were served on a side plate dusted with powdered sugar. The hash browns were crispy on the outside but a bit mushy on the inside and were lacking any flavor. Everything else was very good just not great, no wow at all. 

My coffee cup was consistently refilled and overall the service was excellent.

data.title: Apple Cinnamon Stuffed French Toast !
data.text: Everything on the menu is just fantastic! Don't live in the area, but go way out of my way to have breakfast here. Service is always friendly and quick-portions are great-prices are great!  Cant go wrong here...No fancy curb appeal-just great food at a great price!  Apple Cinnamon Stuffed French Toast is my new favorite!

data.title: From Pittsburgh
data.text: In town for baseball game stopped here from an Internet search. Fantastic breakfast!  The menu was overwhelming. Service was great.

data.title: Breakfast bargain
data.text: Des plaines pancake house is located in a converted convenience store and lacks any curb appeal, although it is close to the Des plaines river walk.  Although it lacks any charm, it delivers consistently good inexpensive breakfasts and lunch items.

data.title: good food, good people
data.text: this is one of my go-to places on sunday mornings.  they have good, freshly prepared food that is very generous for the amount charged.  the staff is super friendly and helpful, too.

data.title: Could make it at home
data.text: not really impressed my omelet was nothing special. My husband had pancakes and said they were a little dry had to put on lots of butter and syrup I'd go back if we had a power outage but otherwise I can make it at home

data.title: Best Breakfast With Great Service
data.text: Cant go wrong here... Great food-super friendly service- I go way out of my way to stop here every week or so...Staff is very accommodating and food is delicious! Fair prices also..What more can you ask for?   I wish I lived closer!

data.title: Best Kept Secret
data.text: I pass by this restaurant at least once a week and wondered about it but never stopped. Decided to try it on a Monday morning for a late breakfast.  This is a family run restaurant and I love to support local businesses. The staff are friendly and attentive. Service is quick and accurate.  They are very accommodating. The food is very good with great flavor and texture. I had the 2x2x2 for $5.75. Excellent and just the right amount of food. I highly recommend and know I will be a repeat customer.  Give this restaurant a try. You won't regret it.

data.title: A family affair.
data.text: This little restaurant is open for breakfast and lunch 7 days week. Very crowded on Sundays after church, but that's because they serve great food with a smile in a pleasant atmospher. Eggs are alway served one more than ordered. Lots of potatoes and ham off the bone fill the platter along with toast and coffee for about $10. per person. I promise you won't leave disappointed or hungry

data.title: Good pancakes - good price - fun place
data.text: Always good comfort food - a place to count on especially when traveling and having plans for the day.  Nice waiters.  Family and friends..good time.
